content: [quoted from SP] that which will not be pinned down by truth, is, in truth, feminine, but this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, nor female sexuality, by dogmatic philosopher, impotent artist, or inexperienced seducer still hoping to capture

content: matrix: 1) situation or surrounding substance in which something originates, develops 2) metal plate used for casting typefaces

content: “dogmatics” of feminism as telos, sinister mystification, will flounder in same homogenized, sterilized river of history of mankind [w/ its age-old dream of reappropriation]

content: once feminism movements reappropriate stifled past, feminism will perhaps have to renounce all too easy progressivism

content: specular reversal of masculine “subjectivity” (even in its most self-critical form, when most jealous of itself and its “proper” objects) represents only one phase of feminism?

content: to say ironically, “there is no one place for woman,” is neither anti-feminist nor feminist, is faithful to affirmative displacement: “dancing” of women

content: perhaps Emma Goldman, wanting only a revolution to dance in, was thinking of tout autre history, w/ paradoxical laws, non-dialectical discontinuities, absolutely heterogenous pockets, incalculable sexual differences [Derrida’s own dream?]
linkedContent: perhaps Emma Goldman, wanting only a revolution to dance in, was thinking of tout autre history, w/ paradoxical laws, non-dialectical discontinuities, absolutely heterogenous pockets, incalculable sexual differences [Derrida’s own dream?]

content: there is a “reactive” feminism that even gains power today—that’s what Nietzsche mocks, and not woman or women [?]

content: worldwide feminism can’t be separated from fundamental Europeanization of world culture

content: poker-like gamble w/ no insurance: “each man and each woman must commit his or her own singularity, the untranslatable factor of his or her life and death”
linkedContent: poker-like gamble w/ no insurance: “each man and each woman must commit his or her own singularity, the untranslatable factor of his or her life and death”

content: some can’t see beyond end of phallic forms in SP (bisexual complication of style, spur, umbrella): those people do not read the syntax and punctuation of a given sentence, arresting the text in a position, settling on a thesis, meaning or truth

content: “essentializing fetishes” (truth, femininity, essentiality of woman or feminine sexuality as fetishes)—but one must be precise about fetishism [i.e. general fetishism in Glas], and its context, if only to displace it
linkedContent: “essentializing fetishes” (truth, femininity, essentiality of woman or feminine sexuality as fetishes)—but one must be precise about fetishism [i.e. general fetishism in Glas], and its context, if only to displace it

content: how can one breathe w/out punctuation, w/out multiplicities of rhythm, steps, how can one dance?
linkedContent: how can one breathe w/out punctuation, w/out multiplicities of rhythm, steps, how can one dance?

content: Derrida introduced 2 phases of deconstruction for sake of clarity: 1) woman reverses structure & becomes dominant 2) “new” concept is forged
linkedContent: Derrida introduced 2 phases of deconstruction for sake of clarity: 1) woman reverses structure & becomes dominant 2) “new” concept is forged

content: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?
linkedContent: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?

content: Derrida uses word “thought,” which is also excessive, instead of philosophy, theory, logic, structure, scene
linkedContent: Derrida uses word “thought,” which is also excessive, instead of philosophy, theory, logic, structure, scene

content: hymen: 1) membranous fold 2) marriage > lies btwn inside/outside of woman, btwn desire & its fulfillment: once pierced there is no hymen

content: new “concept” of woman? was there ever an old one? [deconstruct concept of concept]
linkedContent: new “concept” of woman? was there ever an old one? [deconstruct concept of concept]

content: “positional”: difference determined as opposition, whether or not dialectically
linkedContent: “positional”: difference determined as opposition, whether or not dialectically

content: when sexual difference is determined by opposition, acc. Hegelian dialectics, destines sexual difference for truth—in order to erase/neutralize sexual difference [in masculine sex?]
linkedContent: when sexual difference is determined by opposition, acc. Hegelian dialectics, destines sexual difference for truth—in order to erase/neutralize sexual difference [in masculine sex?]

content: I am going too quickly, I’m schematizing excessively: Heidegger begins by denying all forms of security, all sedimented presuppositions of classical ontology
linkedContent: I am going too quickly, I’m schematizing excessively: Heidegger begins by denying all forms of security, all sedimented presuppositions of classical ontology

content: phallogocentrism, “patrix,” is insurance against return of that which is feared as most agonizing risk
linkedContent: phallogocentrism, “patrix,” is insurance against return of that which is feared as most agonizing risk

content: via phallogocentrism, the “matrix” becomes the “patrix”
linkedContent: via phallogocentrism, the “matrix” becomes the “patrix”

content: Heidegger insists that Dasein is neuter, it is neutral, neither of the 2 sexes, but not indifferent, not annulling negativity—an originary positivity, Mächtigkeit des Wesens
linkedContent: Heidegger insists that Dasein is neuter, it is neutral, neither of the 2 sexes, but not indifferent, not annulling negativity—an originary positivity, Mächtigkeit des Wesens

content: very obscure area, passage btwn ontological difference & sexual difference not punctuated by polarities (originary/derived, ontological/ontic…)
linkedContent: very obscure area, passage btwn ontological difference & sexual difference not punctuated by polarities (originary/derived, ontological/ontic…)

content: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes
linkedContent: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes

content: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)
linkedContent: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)

content: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?
linkedContent: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?

content: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East
linkedContent: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East

content: certain dissymmetry is law of sexual difference & relation to other (Derrida says this in opposition to violence of “democratic” platitudes), dissymmetry as inordinate, excessive, goes beyond coded marks, beyond grammar & spelling of sexuality
linkedContent: certain dissymmetry is law of sexual difference & relation to other (Derrida says this in opposition to violence of “democratic” platitudes), dissymmetry as inordinate, excessive, goes beyond coded marks, beyond grammar & spelling of sexuality

content: no monological discourse, no mono-sexual discourse, necessity for a chorus, a choreographic text w/ polysexual signatures
linkedContent: no monological discourse, no mono-sexual discourse, necessity for a chorus, a choreographic text w/ polysexual signatures

content: in dreaming of saving the chance [of deconstructing sexuality], Derrida would like to believe in multiplicity of sexually marked voices, desire for sexuality w/out # can protect us, like a dream, from an implacable destiny that immures us (everything in life) in #2
linkedContent: in dreaming of saving the chance [of deconstructing sexuality], Derrida would like to believe in multiplicity of sexually marked voices, desire for sexuality w/out # can protect us, like a dream, from an implacable destiny that immures us (everything in life) in #2

content: if merciless closure [of the 2] would arrest desire at wall of opposition, there would never be but 2 > tragedy would leave this strange sense, a contingent one, that we must affirm & learn to love instead of dreaming of innumerable: but doesn’t dream prove what is dreamt of?

content: desire to escape combinatory itself, to invent incalculable choreographies, would remain—even beyond exchange of sexes w/ considerably varied rhythms
